revised_title: Epidemiological and Statistical Analysis of the AIDS Epidemic
tldr: This article presents an analysis of the AIDS epidemic, focusing on the delay between the diagnosis of a case and its notification to the surveillance center. The authors develop a statistical model to predict future aspects of the epidemic, such as the number of patients with AIDS alive at a specific time or the number of patients in hospital. The study highlights the importance of understanding and accounting for notification delays in disease forecasting.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Public Health
